abstract.t: The document provides a specification of the Fake Server Name Indication. Being implemented, the Fake SNI specification provides a way to work around the monitoring solutions without providing any additional information to external observers.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: Many DPI solutions use SNI information as a criteria to filter connection to various sites. Though Encrypted SNI makes impossible to read the SNI value, there is information that absense of SNI looks suspicious itself and all communication is blocked.
This specification introduces a way to provide a value of SNI treated by TLS server as an alias to one of the names known by server but not matching the possibly suspicious host name.

section.title: Fake SNI design goals
section.t: The solution specified in this document is inspired by the design of Encrypted SNI
The provider publishes a name matching the target name to be provided in clear text. This document defines a publication mechanism using DNS, but other mechanisms are also possible.

When a client wants to establish a TLS connection to a domain served by an Fake SNI-supporting provider, it replaces the value in "server_name" extension in the ClientHello with the value obtained by transport. The provider can then find out the desired name from its configuration and either establish the connection with the desired host or reject it.
